PageTitle: peer substitute-as (BGP-VPN instance IPv6 address family view) (group)
FuncDef:
The peer substitute-as command enables AS number substitution in the advertisement direction. That is, the AS number of a specified peer group in the AS_Path attribute is replaced with the local AS number.
The undo peer substitute-as command disables AS number substitution. The peer substitute-as command enables AS number substitution in the advertisement direction. That is, the AS number of a specified peer group in the AS_Path attribute is replaced with the local AS number. The undo peer substitute-as command disables AS number substitution. By default, AS number substitution is disabled. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ParentView: BGP-VPN instance IPv6 address family view,BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv6 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a BGP peer group.
The value is a string of 1 to 47 case-sensitive characters and cannot contain spaces. If the character string is quoted by double quotation marks, the character string can contain spaces.

ExtraInfo: In a BGP public network scenario, when two devices with the same AS number learn a BGP route from each other through the same EBGP peer, the route may be discarded because the AS_Path attribute contains duplicate AS numbers. To prevent this problem, run the peer substitute-as command on this EBGP peer to enable AS number substitution in the advertisement direction.
